text:
Hello everyone, do you know if there is a way to add a custom class to a global_partial, trying to add a class to the wrapper div it prints, and not finding any way
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/global-content>

I am trying to add a text tag to a blog post template. I then want to write this value when using the blog listing module.
Post template has : {% text "meta_field" label="Meta Field", value="some text I want to show on recent post listing", export_to_template_context=True %}
Blog listing has : {{content.widget_data|pprint}} but writes null
Any ideas on what I could try?

This is exactly what I am trying to accomplish but am not able to get it to work - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/export-to-template-context#printing-hubl-module-info-on-blog-listing>

Approximately 2 weeks ago, some of our fields.json fields stopped holding values. Specifically, where we set the sizes of images to use at certain breakpoints in fields.json. Previously, accessing those values from within our custom modules worked correctly. Then, suddenly approx 2 weeks ago, the values all come empty.  And, we didn't make any changes on the site during the time that these stopped working. Does anyone know if some kind of HubSpot update might have affected this? And, if so, how to fix it? My current _temporary_ solution is to just hard-code the image sizes in our custom module. But, ideally, we want the fields in fields.json to work correctly like they did previously. We are using a copy of POWER theme (not a child theme).
Anyone run into the theme colors not being willing to change? I canâ€™t seem to get my primary color to work, but the secondary one does.
